alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis and Clark (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 27 at 3:18PM MST until November 27 at 4:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Lewis and Clark County in west central Montana... North central Jefferson County in southwestern Montana... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 318 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 12 miles north of East Helena to 10 miles east of Garrison, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Trained spotter. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Locations impacted include... Helena, East Helena, Black Sandy State Park, Austin, Rimini and Spring Meadow Lake State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
